Posts.Title: Mucinous Carcinoma - Can I skip rads? lfc123456 mollyann

Posts.Content: lfc123456 wrote: A month ago, I found a lump in my right breast, which is movable, I went to see my doctor, she said" 99% benign fibrodenoma" she ordered ultrasound for me. the radiologist said " 99.9% benign" But I decided to remove it. So I talked to a BS, she said" I am almost 100% sure it is benign, you don't have to do anything" I said " No I want to remove it " Long story short. the biopsy report came back with" Mucinous carcinoma!!" I don't have to repeat my emotions that everyone on this board has experienced. I checked in with MD Anderson right away after I got the biopsy report. they did another round thorough checks and will take 2nd surgery to clean margin ,then they will put me on radiation therapy.  I have done a lot of research, I know this type of cancer is very rare, I am wondering whether I can skip radiation, compare to the long term side effects ( possible new cancer and heart problem) I am so scared..  Can anyone give me some advice? anyone skip radiation and DOING FINE??    Dx 6/14/2010, 2cm, Stage I, Grade 1, ER+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
